page.title: 14PEGGY BELL'S BRIDGE
page.content: The road which passes through the valley only crosses the river Breamish once. This is across a narrow bridge which is known locally as Peggy Bell's Bridge. The reason why it is called this is believed to be because of the following: When there was no bridge, the only way across the river was to try stepping-stones or ride across on horse-back. One person who did this was a woman called Peggy Bell. One night, she tried to cross the river which was also in flood. Her horse stumbled and she was thrown into the water and was drowned. Such a hue-and- cry came out of this tragedy that work was begun on a bridge to cross the river and this became known as Peggy Bell's Bridge.
